subject: Re: Problems running JUnit
msgSnippet: Hello, so I have to write: import X; in the top of the TestX.java ? Magnus ... should ... in ... interfaces
messageBody:
Hello,
so I have to write:
import X;

in the top of the TestX.java
?

Magnus

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi Magnus,
>
> On 10/22/06, Magnus <t703093@...> wrote:
> > But I have red somewhere that @Test methods (in my case, the met
> > method) isn't supposed to be instrumented with parameters and
should
> > not return values. This wont work in JUnit at all?
>
> Yes, the test methods must have no arguments and return void (e.g.
> "public void foo()"). The restrictions should be explained in full
in
> the documentation.
>
>
> On 10/22/06, Magnus <t703093@...> wrote:
> > Also I have to include some importing at the top of the program?
>
> Yes. As with any Java code, you need to import the classes,
interfaces
> and annotations you're using.
>
>
> Lasse
>
